intro: Ketmia glandulosa, commonly known as the sticky leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, sticky glands, giving it a unique texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences, and can range in color from white to pink. Ketmia glandulosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
